Posts.Content: Anne you can check out a percentage on the website NHS Predict   I dont see anyone any more only my GP and couldnt exactly remember what percentage I was given at my last check up - just that my consultant s letter mentioned I would gain a few percentage points doing the extra five years.   I saw on one of the posts you could check it out on the NHS predict.
Posts.Title: Choosing whether to continue into another five years of hormone t...

Posts.Content: Is anyone else facing the huge dilemma of choosing to continue with hormone therapy another five years.   I have completed my five years on Letrozole from which the side effects werent too bad - joint pain etc but did cause me to lose lots of weight so I was worried about my bones My consultant suggested I try Tamoxifen and see how I get on but if the side effects prove difficult it may not be worth the few extra percentage points.   I am getting worse/different side effects on the Tamoxifen after six months and really feel that my body has had enough after chemo radiotherapy and herceptin plus the h=five years hormone.   I am post-menopause.   This is such a hard decision to make and looks as if I am the one that has to make that decision.   Is anyone else in this position.
Posts.Title: Choosing whether to continue into another five years of hormone t...

Posts.Content: Thank you.   I think mine is 4% so you do wonder if its a better bet to try to lead as healthy a lifestyle as possible and keep the body fit and strong to fight any eventuality!
Posts.Title: Choosing whether to continue into another five years of hormone t...

Posts.Content: Yes the joint pains are awful but they stopped when I finished the Letrozole but started again now with the Tamoxifen plus other side effects that I didnt get with the letrozole.   Good luck with your appointment.
Posts.Title: Choosing whether to continue into another five years of hormone t...

Posts.Content: Hi  Such hard decisions arent they when it is left to us to decide.   I guess because its all fairly new and based on a certain amount of research this taking hormone therapy for 10 years and even so I dont think they have much evidence of taking 5 years letrozole followed by five years tamoxifen.   The NHS tool just groups all the hormone therapy together.   I agree - if you are given a higher percentage improvement then I guess its worth battling with the side effects but if its low then its all a balancing act.   Just keep trying to check out all the research.
Posts.Title: Choosing whether to continue into another five years of hormone t...

Posts.Content: I have finished my five years letrozole but I had lots of problems with the different generic brands causing me all sorts of side effects including palpitations from the one   I also found Sandoz was fine but couldnt always get it.   Eventually after another side effect on yet another brand my pharmacist asked me to get a letter from my GP to specifically ask for Femara which I did and all was fine.   However, I still had the usual side effects of the actual Letrozole which is to be expected.
